meanings.definition: A type of paint made from slaked lime and water, used for whitewashing walls.
meanings.sent1: The old farmhouse had walls coated in limewash to give them a fresh, clean look.
meanings.sent2: The painter applied a coat of limewash to the exterior of the building to protect it from the elements.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous kids found buckets of limewash, they decided to have a 'paint war' in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The limewash on the walls transformed the room into a bright and airy space, like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the freshly applied limewash lingered in the air, reminding everyone of a sunny day in the garden.

meanings.definition: To cover or whitewash with limewash.
meanings.sent1: The workers will limewash the brick facade of the building to give it a clean, uniform appearance.
meanings.sent2: She decided to limewash the garden wall to brighten up the outdoor space.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, they limewashed the garden gnome, giving it a 'makeover' that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist's words seemed to limewash over the truth, creating a facade of innocence.
meanings.sent5: The rain began to limewash the sidewalk, washing away the dirt and revealing a clean path underneath.
